page.title: 18Trade In South Kyme
page.content: In the main street is the village shop and Post Office. The shop stocks a variety of foodstuffs, vegetables, fruit and bread. The Post Office is used for purchasing stamps and postal orders, the Giro Bank, Savings Bank and payment of pensions and allowances. There is a postal service on weekdays. Mobile shops visit the village. These include 2 butchers, 1 grocer, 2 fresh fish merchants, and ready cooked fish and chips. A window cleaner visits monthly, milk and papers are delivered daily and coal- merchants also make deliveries. Many people travel to surrounding villages and towns to shop at super- markets which have greater choice and lower prices. Clothing, electrical goods and furniture are also bought outside the village. Mail order firms, often run by local agents are popular.
